Difficulty Notes: Easy optimization problem with intuitive solution
Question: Considering the situation that the blue player has two turns one after the other. which tiles should the blue player choose from the available tile options (A, B, C) so as to get the maximum score by the end of the 2 turns. return the answer in the following format: [Tiles = <selected tile, selected tile>; total_points = <the maximum points by the end of two turns>]
Rationale: In the given image of the game State we can observe that the landscape contains one blue meeple  on an incomplete City and one yellow meeple on an incomplete monastery. According to the rules of the game: 1)Each of the monasteryâ€™s tiles (the 8 surrounding tiles and the one with the monastery itself) is worth 1 point 2) Each tile in the completed city is worth 2 points. Each coat of arms in the completed city is worth an extra 2 points. The player can achieve the maximum number of points in this way: Turn 1: place the tile B in order to complete 2 city features (one with blue knight on it and one without) then place a blue meeple on the empty city on the placed tile. After the placement the total score that the blue player would earn at the end of this turn by rules: (4tiles * 2pts) + (1shield * 2pts) = 10 pts (big city) + (2tiles * 2pts) = 4 pts (small city) = 14 points. Turn 2: Place tile A in the empty square space below the tile containing the road component, and then place a blue meeple on the monastery. As the monastery is completed at the end of this turn, by rules the blue player would get a total of 9 more points. The total points received by the blue player at the end of 2 turns = 14 + 9 = 23 points.
